instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fine, but no green light or backlight.
threads.message:
Known good I/O Board/flex cable.  Damage to camera connector cleaned up so I suspect the I/O socket to blame, but no visible corrosion. Like none at all. :(  Even removed brass cover.

I hate replacing the damn I/O sockets.  

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> goes to high when flex disconnected, then to 1.34 when it's connected.  Pullup is good.
<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> stays at 1.4ish.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fine, but no green light or backlight.
threads.message:
Strange if signals go down when connect good LIO board/flex.
But corrosion underneath J9500 should be the only reason...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fine, but no green light or backlight.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> doesn't make its way through to the DC-in board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fine, but no green light or backlight.
threads.message:
brilliant! already removed j9500, going to continuity test various lines with it off. found hidden corrosion under pad for onewire.   thanks both of you.  I think I'll be able to get the rest.

I just hate doing these connectors.  I usually remove the camera connector just to give myself more room and end up melting some plastic by being impatient, then have to fix misaligned pins ugh

go figure, 3.42 comes into the connector directly next to where the corrosion was!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Boots fine, but no green light or backlight.
threads.message: Yep that did it.  I knew I had to, I think I just needed a push, thanks 2 and piernov.  I only melted the fan connector flap a bit!  Another layer of kapton tape might have helped that.
